alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 2:33PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Period of accumulating snow through 4 PM before mixing with sleet and rain... A band of snow...moderate to briefly heavy...will continue shifting northeast across the southeast Catskills, mid Hudson Valley and northwest Connecticut through 4 PM. Snowfall accumulations of 1 to 2 inches will be possible during this time, especially on colder surfaces and across higher elevations. Travel will become hazardous during this time as untreated ground surfaces become snow covered and slippery, and visibilities drop to under one mile. The snow will then begin mixing with, or changing to sleet and rain in valley areas, and sleet and freezing rain across higher elevations toward and after 5 pm.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
